direction: Use CatBoostClassifier with the following settings: iterations=500, learning_rate=0.03, depth=6. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN values with the median and drop columns with more than 50% missing values. Pass categorical features directly to CatBoost using the cat_features parameter. If you encounter a dtype error, convert categorical columns to strings before passing them to the model.
executor_guidance: Ensure that categorical features are correctly identified and passed to the cat_features parameter in CatBoost. Do not use one-hot encoding or get_dummies, as CatBoost can handle categorical variables natively. Make sure to handle any NaN values in numeric columns by filling them with the median.
memory_update: CatBoost can handle categorical features natively, potentially improving performance on datasets with categorical variables.
